title: Feedback Literacy (Weidlich et al., 2025)
body: Feedback is an important element of teaching and learning. The following questions address how you handle and perceive feedback during your studies. By feedback, we mean any kind of information you receive about your learning progress, your work, your knowledge, or your learning methods. This includes, for example, feedback from various sources (e.g. instructors, fellow students, feedback from the learning environment, etc.), in different forms (e.g. verbal, written, audiovisual, etc.), and at different times (e.g. for final assessments, during tasks, etc.).
